abstract: Maryland violated federal law when it required Wal-Mart to increase spending on health insurance, a court ruled.
snippet: Maryland violated federal law when it required Wal-Mart to increase spending on health insurance, a court ruled.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court ruled today that Maryland violated federal law when it required Wal-Mart Stores to increase spending on employee health insurance, in a decision that appears likely to end a bitter yearlong legal battle that pitted state legislators, organized labor and health care advocates against the nation’s largest retailer.

headline.main: Court Rules for Wal-Mart in Maryland Suit
headline.print_headline: Court Rules for Wal-Mart in Dispute With Maryland
